intro: Capparis pittieri, commonly known as the Mexican sour fig, is a flowering plant native to Mexico and parts of Central America. It is a shrub or small tree that can grow up to 3 meters tall, featuring woody stems and thick, fleshy leaves. The plant produces small, fragrant white flowers that bloom in clusters, followed by edible, sour fruits resembling small figs. Its botanical features include a strong, aromatic scent and a preference for well-drained soils in tropical and subtropical climates. Capparis pittieri is often found in coastal areas and is adapted to withstand salt spray and coastal conditions.
